title: Jamdani Weaving
hero_image_alt: Fine Jamdani muslin saree with floral motifs
short_description: A fine muslin textile with decorative motifs woven on the loom, typical of Bengal.
long_description:
Jamdani is a hand-loom woven fabric made of cotton, which was historically referred to as muslin. The Jamdani weaving tradition differs from other weaving techniques because the embroidery thread is not continuous; it is a supplementary weft technique. 

The weaver uses a non-structural weft in addition to the standard weft that holds the warp threads together. The sheer quality of the fabric coupled with the intricate, artistic designs makes it highly prized.
traditional_methods: Pattern creation directly on the loom.

major_centres.title: Shantipur / Phulia
major_centres.summary: Major centers for Tangail and Jamdani weaving.

authenticity_tips: In authentic Jamdani, the designs are woven into the fabric, not embroidered or printed. You can feel the pattern.
seo_title: Jamdani Weaving: The Fine Muslin Art of Bengal
seo_description: Explore Jamdani, the exquisite woven muslin of Bengal. Known for its sheer texture and supplementary weft motifs.
